Literature Review: Conspiracy theories have become a ubiquitous feature of social and political discourse, with far-reaching consequences for individuals, groups, and societies. Despite their prevalence, the study of conspiracy theories has only gained momentum in the past two decades. This literature review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the defining features of conspiracy theories, their correlates, consequences, and communication patterns. We will examine the existing research on conspiracy theories, highlighting both the progress made and the limitations of current studies. Our analysis will focus on the ontology of conspiracy theories, exploring how their core features determine their adoption, transmission, and impact on individuals and society.
